title: Tips for a Lv.18?
body:
So I just hit Lv.18 (and is currently fixing some networking issues) and so far I've been told a few tips, but I want to seek out more.

My match history is really muddled at this point due to network issues which I'm trying to fix but other than that, I like to play adc and some top, I'm considering getting into some mid but overall don't like support or jungle.

Any general tips?

Thanks guys!

replies.body:
* For each position learn at least two champions for each role, 
* Always play someone you're comfortable with, Never pick "he/she is strong in  this meta" rubbish if you never play.
* When you hit Level 30 dont play ranked instantly , play minimum 300-350 Wins On Norms  that way you have a rough understanding on how the game works 
* Build Runes and Mastires asap even if theyre Tier 1 they will help you a bunch
* play with experienced players, (say a group of mates who are minimum silver, they will teach you the ropes better than some kid in your class who is a master yi main in B5) 
* play to win but remember to have fun, dont troll but remember end of the day its a game but can get competitive

Thanks for this man, I do need more champions that's for sure, and yeah I play what I seem to be good at. Don't worry about ranked, it'll be a while till I get to 30 xD
I do my masteries frequently, but my friend (who hasn't played for a while) said something about how runes are pointless till after Lv.20? Like Tier 3 runes or something I dunno really
And yeah don't worry I haven't and will never intend on trolling ever

Buying tier 2 runes is little to no cost for every single one of them, this will hold until you have enough for a full set of t3,
Do not go into ranked with t2 runes ;P

He has a point but you want to be smarter than the rest of the people starting, youll see a difference with shitty runes than someone with no runes it gives you a small advantage but makes you better in game heaps!

Tier 2 runes are ok for starting out (not for ranked). They only cost 1 IP each, so you can fill up 2 run pages for 60 IP which is really good.

There are 4 main pages you want: Attack Damage, Attack Speed, Ability Power and Tank.
 Since you start with 2 rune pages, it best to build the AD and AP ones.

AD Marks, Armour Seals, Magic Resist Glyphs and AD Quints.
Magic Pen Marks, Armour Seals, Magic Resist Glyphs and AP Quints.

Make sure you check guides/sites for proper builds and masteries. With all the recent changes to masteries and items things may change a lot over the next few weeks, so its kind of a hard time to learn right now. Sites like probuilds.net are helpful in seeing how Challenger and Pro level players are building champions.

Learn what EVERY champion in the game does. You do not need to like them, but by learning how each champion works you will understand better how to counter or play with that champion.

if anyone is being a douche, don't type back, don't acknowledge them at all, just mute. People get angry even when you are friendly and trying to give advice so its best to say nothing.

As a new player. There is a "farming game" you can play which will help with your cs'ing. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2G0osoXFCck

You go into a custom game and try to get to 90+ cs by 10 mins.
